title: I just got my fist turntable (Ion Airlp) and the records keep skipping forward. How can I fix this? - Quora

response.answer_text: As a guess, you have not set it up properly. Turntables need to be level and stable, and the stylus (the “point” that goes in the record groove) needs to be aligned with some care. Also, the “stylus pressure” (how hard that little point presses on the record) must be set properly — too little pressure and the stylus can’t stay in the groove, too much and the record will be damaged more than necessary (every time a record is played it experiences some damage). Perhaps the turntable came with a booklet describing the process.

I would add one thing to the previous answer - “antiskate”. There is normally a method to add some tonearm “pull” towards the center of the record to counteract centrifugal force from the spinning record long story short, check the tracking force (usually 2 grams give or take) and the antiskate setting. Either or both could cause the symptom you are getting. Good luck, enjoy your analog music!
